anns.prefix: Although we did not obtain crystals of a ternary PamZ-acetyl-CoA-
anns.postfix: complex, the position of acetyl-CoA, the well-defined shape of the neighboring pocket and our knowledge about the substrate’s N-terminal acetylation site allows us to predict that the Glm/Aga side chain of paenilamicin very likely penetrates into this pocket.

anns.prefix: Moreover, the structure of PamZ explains its regioselectivity: if PamZ was to modify e.g. the terminal amino group of spermidine in
anns.postfix: , the enzyme would not require such a deep substrate-binding pocket.

anns.prefix: The architecture of the central groove between the NTD and CTD has evolved to optimally accommodate the N-terminal Glm/Aga building block of

, the causative agent of the devastating honey-bee disease American Foulbrood, produces the cationic polyketide-peptide hybrid paenilamicin that displays antibacterial and antifungal activity.

anns.prefix: Its biosynthetic gene cluster contains a gene coding for the N-acetyltransferase PamZ. We show that PamZ acts as self-resistance factor in
anns.postfix: larvae by deactivation of paenilamicin.

anns.prefix: Our results will help to understand the mode of action of paenilamicin and its role in pathogenicity of

anns.postfix: Self-resistance mechanism of P. larvae Self-resistance mechanism of P. larvae The deactivation of paenilamicin through formation of N-acetylpaenilamicin by the action of PamZ (Supplementary Figs. 3–7) implicates that the enzyme may confer self-resistance to the producer strain P. larvae.

anns.prefix: To test this hypothesis, we exposed the deletion mutant
anns.postfix: ∆pamZ to a mixture of paenilamicin A1/B1 in an agar diffusion assay.

anns.prefix: The mixture, which was purified from

anns.prefix: This result demonstrated that
anns.postfix: requires the resistance gene, pamZ, to protect itself from the deleterious effects of its own antibacterial agent, paenilamicin.

anns.prefix: For further experimental support, we analyzed supernatants and cell pellets of
anns.postfix: WT and ∆pamZ for paenilamicins and N-acetylpaenilamicins.

anns.prefix: In cell lysates of
anns.postfix: WT, we exclusively found N-acetylpaenilamicin, whereas for the deletion mutant ∆pamZ only unmodified paenilamicin (Fig. 7b) was detected.

anns.prefix: These findings demonstrate that the self-resistance factor PamZ enables
anns.postfix: WT to acetylate and thus inactivate intracellular paenilamicin.

anns.prefix: N-acetylation functions as an efficient self-protection mechanism by scavenging paenilamicin that reenters the cells of
Accordingly,
anns.postfix: must have developed a dual self-resistance mechanism against paenilamicin both potentially addressing the N-terminal Glm/Aga residue, specifically the N-terminal amino group at Aga-6 position, as modification site.

anns.prefix: Not only
anns.postfix: , but also other bacteria belonging to the Firmicutes refer to a dual self-resistance mechanism associated with NRPS-PKS-derived compounds like amicoumacin42,44, zwittermicin31, and edeine45 (Supplementary Fig. 29).

anns.prefix: This study lays an appreciable foundation to understand the self-resistance mechanisms of
anns.postfix: and to screen for potential small molecule inhibitors that target the active site of PamZ and compete with the naturally occurring paenilamicin.

anns.prefix: Consequently, the inhibitors would disable the self-resistance of
anns.postfix: to paenilamicin resulting in the suicide of the bacterial pathogen for the benefit of the honey bee larvae.

anns.prefix: Such an anti-virulence strategy has the advantage that it circumvents the direct selection pressure on
anns.postfix: to produce resistant strains because it only disarms the bacterium instead of interfering in essential bacterial functions.

anns.prefix: Assuming that the potential candidate has been confirmed in lab-scale applications, it could be applied in honey bee colonies by preventively impregnating the brood comb wax foundations with the substance so that it is dissolved in the brood food and then ingested by the larvae during early larval stages when
anns.postfix: poses the most serious threat.

anns.prefix: In summary, these results expand our knowledge of the molecular strategies exploited by
anns.postfix: to survive in its ecological niche — knowledge that is needed to combat this pathogen and secure the health of bee colonies worldwide.
